title: Stacey Bailey
text:
Stacey Dwayne Bailey (born February 10, 1960) is a former <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a>. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="San%20Jose%20State%20Spartans%20football">San Jose State</a>. He was <a href="Draft%20%28sports%29">drafted</a> in the third round (63rd overall) of the <a href="1982%20NFL%20Draft">1982 NFL Draft</a> by the <a href="Atlanta%20Falcons">Atlanta Falcons</a>.
Early years.
Bailey attended <a href="Terra%20Linda%20High%20School">Terra Linda High School</a> in <a href="San%20Rafael%2C%20California">San Rafael, California</a> and was a <a href="Letterman%20%28sports%29">letterman</a> in <a href="High%20school%20football">football</a>. He then attended <a href="San%20Jose%20State%20University">San Jose State University</a>. As a freshman in <a href="1978%20San%20Jose%20State%20Spartans%20football%20team">1978</a>, he appeared in 12 games. He recorded 23 receptions for 354 yards. As a sophomore in <a href="1979%20San%20Jose%20State%20Spartans%20football%20team">1979</a>, he appeared in 11 games. He recorded 44 receptions for 674 yards and three touchdowns. In <a href="1980%20San%20Jose%20State%20Spartans%20football%20team">1980</a>, as a junior, he appeared in 11 games. He recorded 30 receptions for 686 yards and four touchdowns. For the season, he was named All-<a href="Pacific%20Coast%20Athletic%20Association">Conference</a>. As a senior in <a href="1981%20San%20Jose%20State%20Spartans%20football%20team">1981</a>, he appeared in 12 games. He recorded 27 receptions for 517 yards and six touchdowns. He was also named an <a href="All-America">All-America</a>n as well as All-Conference.
Professional career.
Bailey was selected in the third round (63rd overall) of the <a href="1982%20NFL%20Draft">1982 NFL Draft</a> by the <a href="Atlanta%20Falcons">Atlanta Falcons</a>. As a <a href="rookie">rookie</a>, he appeared in five games. He recorded two receptions for 24 yards and one touchdown. In <a href="1983%20Atlanta%20Falcons%20season">1983</a>, he appeared in 14 games (12 starts). He recorded 55 receptions for 881 yards and six touchdowns. The following season, <a href="1984%20Atlanta%20Falcons%20season">1984</a> was statistically his best, as well as only full 16 game season. He started all 16 games, and recorded 67 receptions for 1,138 yards and six touchdowns. In <a href="1985%20Atlanta%20Falcons%20season">1985</a>, he appeared in 15 games (13 starts). He recorded 30 receptions for 364 yards. In <a href="1986%20Atlanta%20Falcons%20season">1986</a>, he appeared in six games (one start). He recorded three receptions for 39 yards. In <a href="1987%20Atlanta%20Falcons%20season">1987</a>, he appeared in seven games (six starts). He recorded 20 receptions for 325 yards and three touchdowns. In <a href="1988%20Atlanta%20Falcons%20season">1988</a>, he started all 10 games he appeared in. He recorded 17 receptions for 437 yards and, the final two touchdowns of his career. In <a href="1989%20Atlanta%20Falcons%20season">1989</a>, he appeared in 15 games. He recorded eight receptions for 170 yards. In <a href="1990%20Atlanta%20Falcons%20season">1990</a>, he appeared in just three games (one start). He recorded four receptions for 44 yards before his season was ended by an injury, in October 1990. He was released in September 1990 during final cuts.
Personal life.
, Bailey is an instructor at Football University. His son, Sean, was a <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a> for the <a href="Georgia%20Bulldogs%20football">University of Georgia</a>.
